criterion: Provides incorrect information about the varicella vaccine, such as claiming it is not effective or has severe side effects.
Asks the user to clarify their query before providing any information.
Fails to mention that the varicella vaccine is a recommended vaccine by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the World Health Organization (WHO).
Uses technical jargon or overly complex language that may be difficult for a non-medical professional to understand.
Instructs the user to consult a medical professional if they have any concerns or questions about the varicella vaccine.
Provides information about the varicella vaccine without mentioning its potential risks or side effects.
Mentions that the varicella vaccine is only available for children and not for adults.
Asks the user to provide more context or information about their query to better understand their needs.
Fails to mention that the varicella vaccine is a live attenuated vaccine, which means it contains a weakened form of the virus.
